Class JSONHelper

java.lang.Object
JSONHelper
public class JSONHelper
extends java.lang.Object

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    JSONHelper()  

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    static void deleteJSONFile​(java.lang.String filename)
    Deletes the json file in the "Master Files" directory prints a message afterwards to indicate if the operation was successful or not
    static java.lang.String getGameName​(SingleGameServer singleGameServer)
    Gets the player names from the singleGameServer to return a string for the file name in the following format: player1name-player2name.json
    static org.json.simple.JSONObject getJSONObject​(java.lang.String filename)
    Reads the file and parses in to a json object so that we could benefit from key-value pairs of json format.
    static void writeCurrentState​(SingleGameServer singleGameServer)
    It is used to write the current state of the game into a json file.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • JSONHelper

      public JSONHelper()

  • Method Details

    • writeCurrentState

      public static void writeCurrentState​(SingleGameServer singleGameServer) throws java.io.IOException
      It is used to write the current state of the game into a json file. Name of the json file determined as player1name-player2name.json All the necessary information required to write the game is extracted from the singleGameServer instance
      Parameters:
      singleGameServer -
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • getGameName

      public static java.lang.String getGameName​(SingleGameServer singleGameServer)
      Gets the player names from the singleGameServer to return a string for the file name in the following format: player1name-player2name.json
      Parameters:
      singleGameServer -
      Returns:
      name of the file that is used to store game state

    • deleteJSONFile

      public static void deleteJSONFile​(java.lang.String filename)
      Deletes the json file in the "Master Files" directory prints a message afterwards to indicate if the operation was successful or not
      Parameters:
      filename - name of the file that is going to be deleted

    • getJSONObject

      public static org.json.simple.JSONObject getJSONObject​(java.lang.String filename) throws java.io.IOException, org.json.simple.parser.ParseException
      Reads the file and parses in to a json object so that we could benefit from key-value pairs of json format.
      Parameters:
      filename -
      Returns:
      a json object
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException
      org.json.simple.parser.ParseException
